newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Apollo in A$35 million hotel acquisition.
newsitem.headline: Apollo in A$35 million hotel acquisition.

text.p: Singapore's Apollo Enterprises Ltd said on Friday it has agreed conditionally to buy a hotel in Australia for A$35 million through a subsidiary.

Hotel operator Apollo said its subsidiary, Laudet Pty Ltd, would acquire the four-star, 182-room Waratah Central Hotel Sydney, as well as an adjoining site that has been approved for development of an additional 81 rooms.
The hotel's net operating profit before interest, depreciation and taxation for the year ended June 30, 1996 was A$2.6 million.
Apollo said the acquisition would be financed by bank borrowings and from Apollo's existing banking facilities.
